title: 897(1) of the Companies Act 2014 (No. 38 of 2014) (as adapted by the Business,
heading: 1. (1) This Order may be cited as the Companies Act 2014 (Section 897)
text_raw:
1. (1) This Order may be cited as the Companies Act 2014 (Section 897) 

Order 2021. 

(2) This Order (other than Article 4) shall come into operation on 8 

December 2021. 

(3) Article 4 of this Order shall come into operation on 1 March 2022.
text_norm: 1 (1) order may cited company act 2014 (section 897) order 2021 (2) order (other article 4) shall come operation 8 december 2021 (3) article 4 order shall come operation 1 march 2022

title: 897(1) of the Companies Act 2014 (No. 38 of 2014) (as adapted by the Business,
heading: In this Order —
text_norm: 2 order -- act 2014 mean company act 2014 (no 38 2014) act 2000 mean electronic commerce act 2000 (no 27 2000) regulation 2015 mean company act (prescribed form) regulation 2015 (s.i no 147 2015) rule superior court mean rule superior court (s.i no 15 1986)

title: 897(1) of the Companies Act 2014 (No. 38 of 2014) (as adapted by the Business,
heading: 3. (1) The sole means to be used to deliver the following documents to the
text_raw:
3. (1) The sole means to be used to deliver the following documents to the 
Registrar shall be those provided for under the Act of 2000 effected in a manner 
which complies with any requirements of the Registrar of the kind referred to in 
sections 12(2)(b) and 13(2)(a) of that Act: 

(a) 

(b) 

(c) 

(d) 

a notice (SCARP1) which is prescribed under Regulation 4 of 
the Companies Act (Prescribed Form and Notice) Regulations 
2021 (S.I. No. 675 of 2021) for the purposes of section 
558J(2)(a) of the Act of 2014, 

a notice of approval of a rescue plan for the purposes of section 
558Z(5) of the Act of 2014, 

a certified copy of any order made by the relevant court under 
section 558ZD or 558ZZ for the purposes of section 558ZE(4) 
of the Act of 2014, 

a certified copy of the order made by the relevant court under 
section 558ZL(2) for the purposes of section 558ZL(3)(a) of the 
Act of 2014, 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 10th December, 2021. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [676] 3 

(e) 

(f) 

(g) 

a certified copy of any order made by the relevant court under 
subsections (1) and (2) of section 558ZV for the purposes of 
section 558ZV(6) of the Act of 2014, 

a notice of resignation of a process advisor for the purposes of 
section 558ZW(4)(a) of the Act of 2014, and 

a notice of appointment of a process advisor for the purposes of 
section 558ZX(2)(a)(i) of the Act of 2014.

title: 897(1) of the Companies Act 2014 (No. 38 of 2014) (as adapted by the Business,
heading: 4. (1) The sole means to be used to deliver the following documents to the
text_raw:
4. (1) The sole means to be used to deliver the following documents to the 
Registrar shall be those provided for under the Act of 2000 effected in a manner 
which complies with any requirements of the Registrar of the kind referred to in 
sections 12(2)(b) and 13(2)(a) of that Act: 

(a) 

a resolution or agreement for the purposes of section 198(1) of 
the Act of 2014, 

(b) Form C6 which is prescribed under Regulation 35 of the 
Regulations of 2015 for the purposes of section 416(4) of the 
Act of 2014, 

(c) Form C7 which is prescribed under Regulation 36 of the 
Regulations of 2015 for the purposes of section 416(4) of the 
Act of 2014, 

(d) Form E9 which is prescribed under Regulation 37 of the 
Regulations of 2015 for the purposes of section 430(3) and 
441(2)(b) of the Act of 2014, 

(e) Form E8 which is prescribed under Regulation 38 of the 
Regulations of 2015 for the purposes of section 436(1) of the 
Act of 2014, 

(f) 

(g) 

(h) 

(i) 

(j) 

(k) 

(l) 

Form E11 which is prescribed under Regulation 39 of the 
Regulations of 2015 for the purposes of section 436(2) of the 
Act of 2014, 

a notice of appointment of a liquidator for the purposes of 
section 592(1) of the Act of 2014, 

a notice of resignation of a liquidator for the purposes of section 
641(2) of the Act of 2014, 

Form No. 51 which is prescribed under Rule 87(2) of Order 74 
of the Rules of the Superior Courts for the purposes of section 
643(3) of the Act of 2014, 

Form No. 52 which is prescribed under Rule 87(3) of Order 74 
of the Rules of the Superior Courts for the purposes of section 
643(5) of the Act of 2014, 

an account of the liquidator’s acts and dealings for the purposes 
of subsections (3) and (6) of section 680 of the Act of 2014, 

Form No. 39 and Form No. 40 which are prescribed under 
Rule 77 of Order 74 of the Rules of the Superior Courts for 

 
 
 4 [676] 

the purposes of section 681(2) of the Act of 2014, 

(m) a liquidator’s final statement of account for the purposes of 

sections 705(4)(a) and 706(4)(a) of the Act of 2014, 

(n) 

(o) 

a liquidator’s return of the holding of the final meeting for the 
purposes of subsections (4)(b) and (6) of section 705 of the Act 
of 2014, 

a liquidator’s return of the holding of the final meeting for the 
purposes of subsections (4)(b) and (6) of section 706 of the Act 
of 2014, 

(p) Form H15 which is prescribed under Regulation 43 of the 
Regulations of 2015 for the purposes of section 731(1)(d) of the 
Act of 2014, and 

(q) Form H1 which is prescribed under Regulation 46 of the 
Regulations of 2015 for the purposes of section 737(1)(b) of 
the Act of 2014. 

GIVEN under my hand, 
 8 December 2021 

ROBERT TROY, 
 Minister of State at the Department of Enterprise, Trade and 

Employment. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [676] 5

title: 897(1) of the Companies Act 2014 (No. 38 of 2014) (as adapted by the Business,
heading: (This Note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This Note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation) 

The purpose of this Order is to provide that the sole means to deliver the 
documents for the purposes of the Companies Act 2014 listed in Article 3 and 
Article 4 of this Order to the Registrar of Companies is by the means provided 
for under the Electronic Commerce Act 2000, effected in a manner which 
complies with any requirements of the Registrar of the kind referred to in 
sections 12(2)(b) and 13(2)(a) of that Act. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 6 [676]
